intro: Hyoseris montana, commonly known as mountain hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by ray florets, and it produces achene fruits that are dispersed by wind. Hyoseris montana is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions.
